interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Live At The US Festival, 1983
Review Date: 2014/04/02
Store: Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Music Videos & Concerts
Product Description: ["Waylon Jennings appeared at the US Festival on June 4, 1983. It was billed as Country Day, with Waylon performing alongside such artists as Willie Nelson, Alabama, Hank Williams, Jr.., and Emmylou Harris. Waylon's performance was one of the day's many highlights, and he is joined onstage by wife Jessi Colter for a particularly memorable rendition of 'Storms Never Last.' the US Festival was held over two weekends in 1982 and 1983. Steve Wozniak, cofounder of Apple Computer, funded the concerts and accompanying technology exposition, as well as the construction of a brand-new outdoor venue in Glen Helen Regional Park in San Bernadino, CA. Nearly every musical genre was represented by bands as diverse as U2, Fleetwood Mac, David Bowie, Ozzy Osbourne, Willie Nelson, Van Halen, the Police and the Clash. Over the combined seven days of the festival, more than one million people passed through the entrance gates."]
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Waylon Jennings Live At The US Festival, 1983, hard-rock-and-metal-music, Country', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Waylon Jennings', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.47 x 5.33 x 0.68 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'DVDSHFA12928', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 15, 2011', 'Actors': 'Waylon Jennings', 'Studio': 'SHOUT! FACTORY', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I loved this dvd. Yes, it was an oldie, but a goody. It featured Waylon and he was great. The song with him and his wife was awesome.  I highly recommend this
Review Title: Loved it
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------

Live At The US Festival, 1983
Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Music Videos & Concerts
["Waylon Jennings appeared at the US Festival on June 4, 1983. It was billed as Country Day, with Waylon performing alongside such artists as Willie Nelson, Alabama, Hank Williams, Jr.., and Emmylou Harris. Waylon's performance was one of the day's many highlights, and he is joined onstage by wife Jessi Colter for a particularly memorable rendition of 'Storms Never Last.' the US Festival was held over two weekends in 1982 and 1983. Steve Wozniak, cofounder of Apple Computer, funded the concerts and accompanying technology exposition, as well as the construction of a brand-new outdoor venue in Glen Helen Regional Park in San Bernadino, CA. Nearly every musical genre was represented by bands as diverse as U2, Fleetwood Mac, David Bowie, Ozzy Osbourne, Willie Nelson, Van Halen, the Police and the Clash. Over the combined seven days of the festival, more than one million people passed through the entrance gates."]

profile:
The user continues to exhibit a strong preference for classic country music, particularly cherishing the works of iconic artists. Their enjoyment of live performances remains paramount, as reflected in their recent purchase and review of a historical concert DVD featuring Waylon Jennings. The user appreciates performances that highlight genuine artistry and emotional connection, further emphasizing the value they place on authentic concert experiences over studio recordings.

They have provided positive feedback, reaffirming their desire for quality content in the classic country genre. The user's engagement and enthusiasm, evident in their willingness to recommend the content to fellow fans, underscore a community-oriented mindset. 

Key trends include:
- **Genre Preference**: A consistent focus on classic country music and its legendary artists.
- **Media Format**: Continued favor towards DVDs for rich visual and auditory experiences, especially in live concert settings.
- **Content Enjoyment**: Positive feedback highlighting memorable performances, reinforcing their appreciation for engaging and authentic music experiences.
- **Recommendation Behavior**: A strong inclination to share positive experiences with the community, indicating an active participation in the country music fandom.

Overall, the user values high-quality performances, authenticity in music, and meaningful connections with other fans in their entertainment choices.
